page.title: 19CANTERLAND FOREST MARYKIRK 2
page.content: At Canterland plantation, we saw roe buck territory markings and signs that squirrels had been eating cones. Sitka Spruce, Scots Pine and Larch are the main coniferous trees growing at the plantation. On the way to Canterland and around our village you can see many broadleaved trees like Silver Birch, Copper Beech, Oak, Elm, Sycamore, Rowan, Hawthorn, Willow and Ash. Not much work has to be done at Canterland Forest because the trees need no attention until they are ready to be felled in a few years' time. When they are felled, they will be sold to builders, to farmers for fencing or will be shipped to Sweden from Montrose to be pulped for the paper industry.
